description: Impact-tracked economy on Cardano. Every transaction measures compound flows. Land generates sequestration credits. Consumers offset debt.
principles: All economic activity has impact (mostly negative extraction)
No presets - every impact must be measured individually
Only LAND generates sequestration credits (positive capacity)
Nature provides - compare against industrial alternatives
Consumer accumulates all impact debt from purchases
Confidence reflects measurement quality, not certainty
Compound relevance emerges from bioregion and population health
What we track is determined by what needs healing

GLYPHOSATE.name: Glyphosate Exposure
GLYPHOSATE.note: Herbicide residue linked to gut microbiome disruption

PROC_FOOD.name: Ultra-Processed
PROC_FOOD.note: Percentage of calories from ultra-processed sources

MICROBIOME.name: Microbiome Impact
MICROBIOME.note: Effect on gut health: negative = disruption, positive = support

INSULIN_IMPACT.name: Insulin Response
INSULIN_IMPACT.note: Effect on insulin sensitivity: negative = resistance promoting

NEURO_IMPACT.name: Neurological Impact
NEURO_IMPACT.note: Effect on brain health and cognition

NAT_PROV.name: Nature Provided
NAT_PROV.note: Percentage of need met by natural source vs industrial
NAT_PROV.example: 80% iron need from beef vs iron supplement

IND_REQ.name: Industrial Required
IND_REQ.note: How much still requires industrial chain

CHAIN_AVOID.name: Industrial Chain Avoided
CHAIN_AVOID.note: Number of industrial products avoided (supplements, pharma, etc.)

compound_emergence.description: Compound codes emerge recursively through transaction data and health indices - the system learns what to track
compound_emergence.principle: What we track is determined by what needs healing - discovered through the data itself

mechanism: Initial transactions track basic compounds (CO2, H2O, KCAL)
Health indices reveal deficiencies in population (blood tests, clinic data)
Bioregion indices reveal stress in land (soil tests, water quality, biodiversity surveys)
Transaction data aggregates show patterns: which compounds correlate with health outcomes?
Correlations surface new compounds to track
Cycle deepens - more data reveals more connections

example_discovery.observation: Bioregion shows high iron deficiency despite adequate caloric intake
example_discovery.data_query: Which transactions are providing iron? Which are depleting it?
example_discovery.discovery: Soil iron content declining → crops have less iron → population deficient
example_discovery.new_tracking: SOIL_FE (soil iron) becomes priority compound for this bioregion
example_discovery.feedback: Land stewardship practices that restore soil iron get measured and valued

bioregion_health_index.output: Identifies which environmental compounds are stressed
bioregion_health_index.data_source: Land surveys, satellite imagery, watershed monitoring, soil tests

population_health_index.description: Aggregated measure of human health in the bioregion
population_health_index.output: Identifies which nutritional/health compounds are needed
population_health_index.data_source: Anonymized clinic data, public health records, voluntary health sharing

correlation_engine.description: Discovers relationships between transaction compounds and health indices
process: Track transactions with measured compounds over time
Monitor changes in bioregion and population health indices
Identify correlations: which compounds improve which indices?
Surface emerging compounds that weren't initially tracked
Adjust compound priorities based on evidence

step_1_bioregion_health.description: Health indices reveal what's stressed in the bioregion
indicators: Soil degradation → prioritize SOIL, N, P tracking
Air quality issues → prioritize CO2, NOx, CH4 tracking
step_1_bioregion_health.source: Land surveys, satellite data, watershed reports, soil tests

step_2_population_health.description: Health indices reveal what people in the bioregion need
indicators: Iron deficiency prevalence → prioritize IRON, NEED_IRON tracking
B12 deficiency → prioritize B12, NEED_B12 tracking
Vitamin D deficiency → prioritize VIT_D tracking
Protein malnutrition → prioritize PROT, NEED_PROT tracking
Chronic disease patterns → identify relevant nutritional compounds
step_2_population_health.source: Public health data, clinic records, blood test aggregates

step_3_data_driven_discovery.description: Transaction data reveals compounds we didn't know to track
flow: Aggregate transaction compound data across bioregion
Correlate with health index changes over time
Identify: which tracked compounds predict health improvements?
Identify: which untracked factors might explain unexplained variance?
Propose new compounds for tracking based on evidence
step_3_data_driven_discovery.key_insight: The data teaches us what matters - we don't have to know in advance

bioregion_compound_profiles.description: Each bioregion develops its own compound priority profile

universal_vs_emergent.emerge_from_bioregion: Environmental compounds based on local stress
universal_vs_emergent.emerge_from_population: Nutritional/health compounds based on local needs
universal_vs_emergent.note: The compound registry is comprehensive, but relevance is local

10-29.description: AI estimate, regional average - MUST verify

land_sequestration.description: Only land generates positive offset capacity
land_sequestration.credit_generation: Land stewards generate credits based on area x rate x time (cycles of ~37 days)

debt_offset.description: Consumers purchase sequestration credits to offset impact debt
debt_offset.natural_quota: ~4 tonnes CO2-equivalent per person per year
debt_offset.market: Credits traded between land stewards and consumers
debt_offset.conversion: 1000 impact units = 1 tCO2 for offset purposes

command_templates.description: Templates for generating CLI commands. LLMs should use these patterns.

transfer.example: npm run transfer -- --to Alice --amount 8 --type goods --compound CO2:-450:75 --compound H2O:-120:60 --compound PROT:25:90 --compound IRON:3:85 --compound NEED_IRON:80:70 --desc "Grass-fed beef 200g - transport CO2 from fuel receipt, iron for documented deficiency"
notes: Quantity is signed: negative for extraction/emission, positive for delivery/sequestration
Confidence must match measurement method used
Description should explain what was measured and how

land_mint.example: npm run land:mint -- --name "Quincy Forest" --area 160000 --type forest --bioregion sierra_nevada

notes: Only land stewards can generate credits

grass_fed_beef_with_health_context.scenario: Person with documented iron deficiency buys local grass-fed beef
grass_fed_beef_with_health_context.key_insight: Nature provided what would otherwise require pharmaceutical/industrial chain

almond_milk_full_accounting.scenario: Almond milk purchase with full environmental accounting
almond_milk_full_accounting.key_insight: Low carbon but high water and biodiversity cost - all must be measured

renewable_energy_honest.scenario: Solar panel electricity - still has negative impact, just less
renewable_energy_honest.key_insight: Renewable is not 'positive' - it's less negative than fossil (which would be -250g CO2)

regenerative_vs_industrial.scenario: Comparing pastured eggs from regenerative farm vs conventional store eggs
regenerative_vs_industrial.key_insight: Same food, vastly different health impact. The industrial system creates chronic disease; regenerative heals.

processed_food_exposure.scenario: Ultra-processed snack bar vs whole food equivalent
processed_food_exposure.key_insight: Same calories, opposite health trajectory. Processed food drives chronic disease; whole food heals.

how_to_measure.transport_co2: fuel_liters x 2.31 kg CO2/L diesel or 2.39 kg/L gasoline
how_to_measure.electricity_co2: kWh x grid_factor (varies: 0.4-0.9 kg CO2/kWh by region)
how_to_measure.water: Direct meter, processing spec sheets, or LCA databases
how_to_measure.nutrition: USDA FoodData Central, lab tests, or product labels
how_to_measure.health_needs: Medical records, blood tests, documented deficiencies

confidence_guidance.90+: Use only with lab tests, certified measurements, or direct meter readings
confidence_guidance.70-89: Calculated from documented receipts, invoices, or specifications
confidence_guidance.30-49: Estimates based on similar verified activities
confidence_guidance.below_30: AI/LLM estimates - flag for verification within 30 days

when_helping_users: Always ask what was actually measured and how
Never assume positive impact - even renewables have negative footprint
Require confidence levels that match the measurement method
Consider the full chain: production -> nutrition -> health -> care economics
Compare nature providing vs industrial alternative when relevant
Consider bioregion context - what compounds are priority for this region?
Consider user health context - what deficiencies/needs does this person have?
health_philosophy: Root cause over symptom management - track what causes chronic disease
Food is medicine - whole foods from healthy soil heal; processed foods harm
Industrial food system accountability - glyphosate, seed oils, antibiotics in supply chain
Question synthetic interventions - pharma addresses symptoms, nature addresses causes
Gut health is foundational - microbiome disruption underlies many chronic conditions
Environmental health = human health - soil health, water quality, air purity affect us
Individual health sovereignty - people own their health data and make informed choices
Transparency over convenience - know what you're consuming and its true impact
compound_selection: Compounds are not arbitrary - they emerge from bioregion and population health
Ask: What is stressed in this bioregion? (water, soil, biodiversity, air)
Ask: What does this person need? (iron, B12, protein, vitamin D)
Ask: What root cause factors are present? (glyphosate, seed oils, heavy metals)
Track what matters locally, not a global one-size-fits-all list
The act of tracking informs future understanding of what needs healing
Compare: whole food from regenerative source vs processed industrial alternative
generating_commands: Use the command_templates section to construct valid CLI commands
Include all measured compounds with appropriate confidence levels
Description should explain the measurement methodology
Quantity sign: negative for consumption/emission, positive for delivery/benefit
Prioritize compounds relevant to the bioregion and individual health context

endpoints.note: Fetch this spec to understand the protocol
